snippet.textDisplay:
Okay I'm gonna put my opinion in.
I agree with people saying that Skyword Sword had a very dull atmosphere. I was often bored or frustrated in the game. The only thing I enjoyed was the storyline and how the characters looked. To be honest, I never completed the game since I felt pressured to.
As for Twilight Princess, it's my first Zelda game. I love the storyline, the characters, the scenery, the music, everything. I'm replaying it now. Ocarina of Time was amazing too, and now the connections to other games with it are more evident. Wind Waker is fun and seems really easy to me. But I love it all the same.
snippet.textOriginal:
Okay I'm gonna put my opinion in.
I agree with people saying that Skyword Sword had a very dull atmosphere. I was often bored or frustrated in the game. The only thing I enjoyed was the storyline and how the characters looked. To be honest, I never completed the game since I felt pressured to.
As for Twilight Princess, it's my first Zelda game. I love the storyline, the characters, the scenery, the music, everything. I'm replaying it now. Ocarina of Time was amazing too, and now the connections to other games with it are more evident. Wind Waker is fun and seems really easy to me. But I love it all the same.

snippet.textDisplay:
@AngelkittenArtist Yeah, at first I too thought Skyward Sword was... ok...But the time I was playing it back in 2011-12 I really didn't want to play it, I was more into online games and I was not prepared or in the mood of playing a console game with storyline and things like that, so I played and finished the game because you know, if a Zelda game comes out, you just HAVE to play it, and I was forcing myself, it was all my fault...
But the more I remember the game, the more I like it, I think you should finish it or play it again, I realized it is the Zelda game with best gameplay yet, really, the gameplay is just flawless, specially the flying controls!
I guess it is one of those games you get to appreciate when time passes by...
It is a shame you'll never know how was playing all the great Zelda games before TP when they came out, and one of the biggest hypes on videogame history when TP was announced back in 2004.

But the more I remember the game, the more I like it, I think you should finish it or play it again, I realized it is the Zelda game with best gameplay yet, really, the gameplay is just flawless, specially the flying controls!
I guess it is one of those games you get to appreciate when time passes by...

snippet.textDisplay: I liked this game, but the dungeons were a chore. After a while I realized that the dungeons were the thing that people played Zelda for, and figured that Zelda just wasn't for me.

snippet.textDisplay: I son't care which Zelda game Shigsy makes as long as it's a Zelda game made by him that's awesome. They should mix it up between the two, but I think he should focus more on the WW route. sigeru has made lots of drastic decisions, none have been bad yet. I mean, he advised Retro studios to turn Metroid Prime into an FPS. Everyone was mad at first, but look at how immersive those games are. A little bit of the old can't be bad though as long as it has some differences like TP did.
snippet.textOriginal: I son't care which Zelda game Shigsy makes as long as it's a Zelda game made by him that's awesome. snippet.textDisplay:
I have no problems with either games to be honest.

WW was a more typical Zelda, in terms of how it was set, but too a venture into uncharted waters, no pun intended, by changing the artistic design. 
TP, on the other hand, was darker and more gritty but with an artistic design that was more familiar. I don't know that the game was made this way to appease fans or if it was an experiment in returning to OoT. 

To me, TP was the better game, I loved every second of it.
snippet.textOriginal:
I have no problems with either games to be honest.

WW was a more typical Zelda, in terms of how it was set, but too a venture into uncharted waters, no pun intended, by changing the artistic design. 
TP, on the other hand, was darker and more gritty but with an artistic design that was more familiar. I don't know that the game was made this way to appease fans or if it was an experiment in returning to OoT. 

To me, TP was the better game, I loved every second of it.

snippet.textDisplay: The real fans didn't bash WW though..sure when people first saw screen caps people may have been a little hesitant but I cant see any real Zelda fan not liking WW after playing through it. snippet.textDisplay: @Phenolatukas Nah, it sounds to me more like some kind of audio defect.  There was never any wind whistling through the trees in the game.  There are similar weird effects with a few other songs from various soundtracks rips of TP: e.g. most videos of Ordon Ranch on YouTube have a kind of running water sound, even though there was no water near the ranch, in game.  No idea what causes it.
snippet.textOriginal: @Phenolatukas Nah, it sounds to me more like some kind of audio defect.  There was never any wind whistling through the trees in the game. snippet.textDisplay:
@Mooglecito Dont worry man. In a recent interview with Eiji Aonuma he said they don't really look what the fans want when making a new Zelda game. 

I think TP is the only game where they kinda did that, and learned from that. Not that TP was a bad game of course.
snippet.textOriginal:
@Mooglecito Dont worry man. In a recent interview with Eiji Aonuma he said they don't really look what the fans want when making a new Zelda game. 

I think TP is the only game where they kinda did that, and learned from that. Not that TP was a bad game of course.

snippet.textDisplay: @Mooglecito TP is catering to the fans but the game was innovative (eg the dragons fought via hookshot) this was partially because it couldnt rely on the m.plus. SS is killer but I almost feel like TP's puzzles were more of a challenge + not as much prompting from Link's sidekick in order to complete tasks. Aside from this SS works well imo. If TP's scale was too ambitious & Zelda builds on the SS route, it could be good. In any case some fans will bash any series, cant win em all.
snippet.textOriginal: @Mooglecito TP is catering to the fans but the game was innovative (eg the dragons fought via hookshot) this was partially because it couldnt rely on the m.plus. snippet.textDisplay: This song really confuses the player as to the mood they should be feeling while walking through the forest.  You want to feel safe and secure and admire the beauty of the forest but at the same time you feel like there's something at every corner trying to kill you... an unsettling feeling. Beautiful composition.

snippet.textDisplay: @AkhmedSync yeah but nintendo keeps gaining new fans which are kids, so i say they can take whatever route they wanna.
snippet.textOriginal: @AkhmedSync yeah but nintendo keeps gaining new fans which are kids, so i say they can take whatever route they wanna.

snippet.textDisplay: @AkhmedSync Actually, that's true, but for the wrong reasons. Children tend to play games like GTa or CoD because they think it's cool to play only "grown-up" stuff, so they only buy "mature" games that contain blood, gore and sex. And yet adults are the main demographic buying games aimed at children (like Kirby's Epic Yarn, Katamary or Pokemon) because with their maturity they can appreciate the games for the fun they bring instead of the lack of violence
snippet.textOriginal: @AkhmedSync Actually, that's true, but for the wrong reasons. Children tend to play games like GTa or CoD because they think it's cool to play only "grown-up" stuff, so they only buy "mature" games that contain blood, gore and sex. And yet adults are the main demographic buying games aimed at children (like Kirby's Epic Yarn, Katamary or Pokemon) because with their maturity they can appreciate the games for the fun they bring instead of the lack of violence

snippet.textDisplay:
Most Zelda fans are divided on how the Zelda series should progress. 

Take the WW route, letting Miyamoto do what he wants with his game resulting on the fans bashing it?

Or the TP route, giving fans what they want, only to they bash it later for being more of the same?

Sadly the Zelda fanbase is going to the route of the FF or Sonic fanbase now.
snippet.textOriginal:
Most Zelda fans are divided on how the Zelda series should progress. 

Take the WW route, letting Miyamoto do what he wants with his game resulting on the fans bashing it?

Or the TP route, giving fans what they want, only to they bash it later for being more of the same?

Sadly the Zelda fanbase is going to the route of the FF or Sonic fanbase now.

snippet.textDisplay: Morpha was the evil causing drought in the Hylian Lake and all those problems with the Zoras - so it works for that too. Yeah they might be a little forced, but at least they were all properly integrated into the main plot. Also OoT is a masterpiece and the greatest game ever created imho (my list of the truely great games on Nintendo Consoles being OoT, ToS, Resident Evil 4, SSBM, Goldeneye 64, Perfect Dark, DK Racing, Mario Kart DS, Banjo Kazooie and both SM 64 and SM Galaxy)

snippet.textDisplay:
Not true- all of the bosses in OoT were integral connected to their dungeon:
Gohma: Queen of the Dekus, parasite killing the Deku Tree.

King Dodongo: King of the Dodongos, enemies of the Gorons.

Barrinade: Parasite inside Jabu Jabu

Volvagia: Ancient beast awakened by Ganondorf. Darunia went to slay it. It's mentioned a crapload.

Morpha: OK, you've got me here.

Bongo Bongo: Ancient evil hidden in the well; unleashed by Ganondorf.
snippet.textOriginal:
Not true- all of the bosses in OoT were integral connected to their dungeon:
Gohma: Queen of the Dekus, parasite killing the Deku Tree.

King Dodongo: King of the Dodongos, enemies of the Gorons.

Barrinade: Parasite inside Jabu Jabu

Volvagia: Ancient beast awakened by Ganondorf. Darunia went to slay it. It's mentioned a crapload.

Morpha: OK, you've got me here.

Bongo Bongo: Ancient evil hidden in the well; unleashed by Ganondorf.

snippet.textOriginal: How does Zelda always amaze me? They keep sequelizing it every 2 years or so, but it just gets better, never gets dull!

snippet.textDisplay: The music was good but the Hyrule field appeared to me very unnatural also because I feld caged the first time I walked on it, you could only go one way because the other ways were closed by rocks! That seemed very implausible to me. Thats one example but the whole game is composed like this: You have to go one direction with no stops and very seldom sidequests. Nice graphics, yes, but this didnt impress me just like "Star Fox Adventures" for GC. Also boring story, only the bosses were good :)
snippet.textOriginal: The music was good but the Hyrule field appeared to me very unnatural also because I feld caged the first time I walked on it, you could only go one way because the other ways were closed by rocks! That seemed very implausible to me. Thats one example but the whole game is composed like this: You have to go one direction with no stops and very seldom sidequests. Nice graphics, yes, but this didnt impress me just like "Star Fox Adventures" for GC. Also boring story, only the bosses were good :)

snippet.textDisplay: Thank you. Yeah, they all are very similar and in particular TP to OoT. Myamoto said this had been the last Zelda game in its old style. So by and by it was time to modernize Zelda and make it a mature game. With TP they topped the highest mountain of my patience. I'm ready to forgive, if the current project will blow me away.
snippet.textOriginal: Thank you. Yeah, they all are very similar and in particular TP to OoT. Myamoto said this had been the last Zelda game in its old style. So by and by it was time to modernize Zelda and make it a mature game. With TP they topped the highest mountain of my patience. I'm ready to forgive, if the current project will blow me away.

snippet.textDisplay: You have a right to your opinion, I don't know why everyone's getting so upset with you. Anyway, I think that TP is excellent from what I've played, though I see your point: it is very similar to OoT. (But aren't they all fairly similar?) Anyway, they really need to have some voice acting by now. :P
snippet.textOriginal: You have a right to your opinion, I don't know why everyone's getting so upset with you. Anyway, I think that TP is excellent from what I've played, though I see your point: it is very similar to OoT. (But aren't they all fairly similar?) Anyway, they really need to have some voice acting by now. :P

snippet.textDisplay: I've never thought of Zelda as an RPG...really an action-adventure game with puzzle and RPG elements. 0.o

snippet.textDisplay: Are you kidding me? This song is awesome.

snippet.textDisplay: This game is nearly the complete remake of "Ocarina of Time". The only differneces to it are its senseless story and the fully Zelda-untypical game composition. Anyway, the producers said it was the best Zelda of all time and so I bought this impotent sucking WASTE of time. Possibly that's my problem, is it? Do you maybe now a bit agree with me, little kidz? Uncle Sammy isn't here.

snippet.textDisplay:
I don't like Zelda music, but the intro movie theme from Twilight Princess is the best orchestrated music ever composed.

It's incredible that Nintendo was able to compose such a thing...
